archimate:Principle.name: Secure By Default
archimate:Principle.documentation:
Statement: Be secure by default
Rationale: A mechanism that, in the event of failure, responds in a way that will cause no harm, or at least a minimum of harm, to other devices or danger to personnel. Implication: Stress under load and hard failure situations should be incorporated into security testing. Default system configuration at start-up must be secure.
